definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
not the right flavor/not quite right/a bit off/fishy/queer/amiss/feel bad/be upset
(of food) to have the right taste/(of people) to feel at ease
erhua variant of 人情味[ren2 qing2 wei4]
erhua variant of 沒人味|没人味[mei2 ren2 wei4]
erhua variant of 走味[zou3 wei4]

sentences.english: This fish will go bad if you don't put it in the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 这条鱼如果不放进冰箱就会变味儿。

sentences.english: We should show empathy when we deal with problems.
sentences.chinese: 我们处理问题也要有些人情味儿。

sentences.english: The waiting-room was gloomy, of course, and it smelled badly.
sentences.chinese: 候车室阴沉沉的，那个味儿如一惯地难闻。

sentences.english: Regardless of how others, the annual taste out of their own too.
sentences.chinese: 不管别人怎样，年味儿是自己过出来的。

sentences.english: Women think all beer is the same。
sentences.chinese: 女人觉得所有品牌的啤酒都是一个味儿。
黄油里肯定有一股怪味儿。

sentences.english: The smell of red pepper being fried irritates the nose.
The water which comes to a boil does not give the best taste.
sentences.chinese: 水是来烧开没有获患上最好的滋味儿。

sentences.english: Neither of my children have ever mentioned a fishy taste or fish burps.
sentences.chinese: 我们的孩子没有提到鱼味儿。

sentences.english: Give yourself permission to be human.
sentences.chinese: 允许自己富于“人情味儿”。

sentences.english: Rounds of bread aroma directly toward the muzzle, he energetically the Yanzhao saliva.
sentences.chinese: 一阵阵面包香味儿直扑鼻口，他使劲的咽着口水。

sentences.english: The room smelled musty and stale.
sentences.chinese: 这个房间闻起来有股发霉的陈味儿。

sentences.english: They all are good, just different style, we should taste them from different sides.
sentences.chinese: 它们都美，只是韵味儿不同，要从不同的角度来欣赏。
孩子们更喜欢草莓味儿的酸奶。

sentences.english: Why is food at the student canteen always so tasteless?
sentences.chinese: 学生食堂的饭怎么总是这么没滋没味儿？

definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
